title: Drawing, "The Bedroom of Czarina Maria Alexandrovna, Gatchina Palace, St. Petersburg", 1920s
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite, red chalk on white wove paper
signed: At lower right, in pen and black ink: Alexander/ Benois
inscribed: Lower right, in graphite: chambre/ de/ l'Imperatrice Marie/ Alexandrovna à/ Gatchina
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Bury Street Gallery, London - Jane, Lady Abdy; as yet unidentified sale (see Thaw artist file); Princess Naryshkin, daughter of Count Sergei Iulevitch Witte (according to aforementioned sale catalogue).
description: This bedroom is decorated in typical Victorian style, with floral-patterned walls, upholstery and bed drapery. The highly polished Rococo Revival furniture, carpet in a floral design covering the floor, blue and gold Venetian glass central chandelier and portrait in a gilded frame hung over the sofa complete the decorative scheme.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Bedroom of Czarina Maria Alexandrovna, Gatchina Palace, St. Petersburg", 1920s.
1920s. Brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite, red chalk on white wove paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-76.
